text: The Principlists (, ), also known as the Iranian Conservatives Open access material licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial- NoDerivs 3.0 Unported License. and formerly known as the Right or Right-wing, are one of two main political factions in post-revolutionary Iran; the other being the Reformists. The term hardliners that some western sources use to describe Iranian politicians, usually refer to this faction. Within Iranian politics, "principlist" means the conservative supporters of the Supreme Leader of Iran and supports protecting the "principles" of the Islamic Revolution's early days. ==Notes== ==References== Category:Politics of Iran
title: Iranian principlists
